summary: Since 1974, the Shadow Wolves—a highly trained Native American investigations unit—have used traditional and modern methods to combat smuggling from Mexico to the Tohono O'odham Nation reservation in Arizona. They're part of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. We assessed ICE's progress in addressing our 6 prior recommendations to improve the Shadow Wolves program. ICE fully addressed 1 and made progress on 2 others, but more...
title: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement: Update on Planning for Unit of Native American Law Enforcement Personnel
